dcterms:description: ISIC-2018 is one of the most representative and challenging two-dimensional skin lesion segmentation datasets in computer-aided diagnosis, with 2594 images and fine annotations. They are randomly divided into a training set and a test set, where the training set consists of 2074 images and the test set consists of 520 images.
dcterms:title: ISIC-2018

D. Zhang
dcterms:description: The DSB2018 dataset contains a total of 670 images with accurate annotations. Of these, 80% are used for training, 10% for validation and 10% for testing.
dcterms:title: DSB2018

dcterms:description: The Synapse dataset uses 30-segment abdominal CT scans from the MICCAI 2015 challenge and contains 3779 axial contrast-enhanced clinical CT images of the abdomen.
dcterms:title: Synapse

dcterms:description: The Kvasir-SEG dataset contains images for polyp segmentation, with significant variability in size and shape, and often blurred boundaries.
dcterms:title: Kvasir-SEG
